question: Which of the following is false?

choices.option: Both waves and particles will ricochet upon collision.
Multiple waves can occupy the same position, multiple particles cannot.
choices.explain: Waves will interfere with each other but remain distinct after they pass. Particles ususally obey the Pauli-Exclusion principle.
The "double slit" experiment shows us that photons can interfere like waves.
Einstein's interpretation of the "photoelecric" effect proves that light is comprised of descrte quantas.
